H0.text: where did the yoruba originated from. Ancient Egyptians

H1.text: where did the yoruba originated from. Mesopotamians

H2.text: where did the yoruba originated from. Indo-Europeans

H3.text: where did the yoruba originated from. African people

A4.text: Genetic studies have shown the Yoruba to cluster most closely with West African peoples, followed by Central and Eastern African groups speaking Niger-Congo languages.

A5.text: The Yoruba constitute more than 50 million people in Africa, and over a million outside the continent, and bear further representation among the African diaspora.
